page.title: 12Felixstowe Dock - History.
page.content: In 1875, the Felixstowe Dock and Pier Co. was formed. Then, in 1882, work on the tidal basin commenced. It was finished and ready for use in 1886. At this time, the dock consisted merely of the tidal basin and a few warehouses. It was first used as a cargo port with no passengers. Just before the port was opened, a railway link had been opened with Westerfield, 13 miles away close to the Great Eastern Railway line. The first passenger train ran on 1st. May 1877. It was owned by the Felixstowe Dock and Railway Co. Soon after this, the first freight train came to Felixstowe as Colonel Tomline was developing his port. The passenger train service didn't make much money so the railway and rolling stock were taken over following the Great Eastern and Felixstowe Railways Act 1887.
